docs.lead_paragraph: In the late 1950's, dozens of idealistic young men and women went to Kenneth Clark for direction. He was an academic, black, articulate, and already a veteran in the movement--civil rights--they wanted, fervently, to join. He remembers one of them well:

headline.main: ROBERT COLES: DOCTOR OE CRISIS; COLES

docs.abstract: Paul Wilkes article on Coles's career as 'social psychiatrist' and observer of the oppressed; he and wife discuss family life and works on children and women in crisis; illus (L)
